entry.title: Eigenschemes and the Jordan canonical foem
entry.summary: In this paper, we are concerned with a certain ideal that can be associated with any complex valued square matrix. The ideal is shown to encode information about the eigenvectors and the generalized eigenvectors of the matrix. One of the goals of the paper is to describe a primary decomposition of the ideal (or equivalently a decomposition of the scheme associated with the ideal, which we call the eigenscheme, into irreducible components). These primary components are shown to encode information about the Jordan structure of the matrix. We describe how the eigenscheme can be interpreted as the zero locus of a global section of the tangent bundle on projective space. This interpretation allows one to see eigenvectors and generalized eigenvectors of matrices from an alternative viewpoint.
